adrFormatAddress: 56 7th Ave, New York, NY 10011, USA

editorialSummary.text: Local coffeehouse chain serving thoughtfully-sourced, house-roasted brews in a hip, bustling space.

originalText.text:
My visit to Birch Cafe was a delightful exploration of exquisite cappuccinos. The rich and flavorful brew they serve is undeniably delicious, making it a haven for coffee enthusiasts. Admittedly, Birch leans towards the pricier end, but the unparalleled quality of their cappuccinos justifies the cost.

The cafe's ambiance is a bit snug, creating an intimate setting that might not be for everyone. However, what truly sets Birch apart is its exceptional service. The staff's efficiency is impressive, delivering a fast and excellent experience that adds to the overall appeal of the cafe.

If you're willing to indulge in a slightly tighter and pricier setting, Birch Cafe promises a memorable coffee journey with its delectable cappuccinos and top-notch service.

originalText.text: Only downfall is the price but that’s everywhere right $5.99 for mocha with $1 tip so it’s quite a lot for the small size. Three cute bar tables and two staff came out quick. Good a little burnt tasting, cute little cups with the names though! Also they have a stamp card!!

originalText.text: High quality coffee and incredible service. This brand knows what it’s doing and is a true small business. It’s not a conglomerate. They value customers and coffee. Support them not just because they are doing the right thing but because they are doing things right for planet and people!

text.text: High quality coffee and incredible service. This brand knows what it’s doing and is a true small business. It’s not a conglomerate. They value customers and coffee. Support them not just because they are doing the right thing but because they are doing things right for planet and people!

originalText.text: There is a woman who works here that i simply adore, I see her every morning she is there and she just makes my day because she asks how I’m doing and we talk about her child and we share our lives. I’m sure people understand how important the culture of a coffee shop is, especially in a place like New York. It’s the reason I come to this place and it is because of her, she’s the manager, it’s because of her that this place feels so good and why people keep coming back. It’s not just me with which this reporte exists. It makes me smile to see the community experience the same even tho we are in union square busy central and I’m just so grateful to her and the staff she so obviously leads to the same. This company should give her a raise!!

originalText.text: My favorite coffee shop of ALL TIME!! It’s a mix of all the best things you’d hope to find in a neighborhood coffee shop. You’ve got the amazing baristas that greet you with so much warmth & friendliness, the delicious smell of the beans roasting (& brewed in our very own city) the coziness that welcomes you in from the cold on a winter morning & vibey refuge found in their iced lattes on a hot summers day.  I order a vanilla iced latte with almond milk always but I’ve brought friends whose orders range from cortados, drip, cappuccinos, etc. and they’ve loved it enough to keep coming back! The people here are amazing. Nya, Jack, Abby & co. do an amazing job at keeping Birch WV my favorite place to start all of my days!
